basic.floral_language:
Crassula mesembryanthoides ssp. hispida
Floriography: gentle, lovely, beautiful
Has a similar appearance to Crassula mesembrianthoides ssp. hispida with longer leaves like fox tails and needle-like leaf tips. Leaves sink in the middle, covered by dense white hairs, fluffy and lovely, in a cool season with abundant sunlight, leaves turn red, often used in combinations with other small succulents in pots.
Likes sunshine, has a summer dormant period, need shade properly under scattered light and reduce watering. Flowers are orange.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, with a great diurnal temperature range, with adequate sunlight turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with bright scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
